children.subject: I have a similar question -- I've made a few web apps on the side, and I was wondering how I'd market/monetize these apps as well.

history.content:
In all honesty -- app monetization is really difficult these days due to the over-saturation of the app market and the difficulty of getting your app "discovered." Ads are the most common way of generating income on a mobile platform from what I have seen -- however finding that balance between putting enough ads to make money and not putting so many such that you overwhelm your users is tough. Unfortunately you are going to run into the unreliability that you are experiencing with Admob no matter what due to the nature of how ads work unless you have a significant error in how you implemented the SDK. Admob really is the de-facto ad network currently with how flexible and widely used it is so I wouldn't recommend any alternatives.

Speaking from my own experience making money from apps, when I released my first app to the App Store a few years back the most significant source of income was via "premium" IAPs. See if you can think of some ways to monetize specific features of your app and charge for them (even if its just for $0.99).

Happy to help if you have any more questions! Good luck with your app :)

Ive been making some mobile apps as a side project. I am currently using Admob for mobile add monetization, which is quite faulty, as it does not always display adds and does not bring in the expected revenue that it could. I was wondering if anyone else on here has had experience with third party add platforms that are reliable?
history.subject: App development monetization
